summary: This document is an email from Jeffrey Epstein to Jes Staley discussing a potential approach to Abu Dhabi regarding financial advice. Epstein suggests that Staley could offer his services for free, contingent upon the implementation of his advice related to asset sales. The email emphasizes confidentiality and potential attorney-client privilege.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email, proposing a financial strategy to Jes Staley.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is the recipient of the email, who is advised by Epstein on approaching Abu Dhabi for financial advice.

connections.description: Epstein advises Staley on a potential financial strategy involving Abu Dhabi.

keyFacts: The email suggests that Jes Staley should approach Abu Dhabi as a key player in the financial system.
Epstein proposes that Staley offer his advice for free, contingent on the implementation of his suggestions.
The communication is marked as confidential and may be attorney-client privileged.
